Title: To map out
Example: We need to map out the project timeline for the next quarter.

Title: To spearhead
Example: I spearheaded the migration to the new cloud platform.

Title: To roll out
Traducci√≥n: To launch or implement something new
Example: We're rolling out the new security software next week.

Title: To phase in / phase out
Example: We'll phase out the old system as we phase in the new one.

Title: To figure/work out
Traducci√≥n: To solve, understand, or find a solution
Example: My team and I figured out a workaround for the bug.

Title: To nail down
Example: Let's nail down the budget before we proceed.

Title: To carry out
Traducci√≥n: To execute or perform a task
Example: We successfully carried out the server upgrade with zero downtime.

Title: To iron out
Traducci√≥n: To resolve small problems or difficulties
Example: We're meeting to iron out the final kinks in the user interface.

Title: To come up with
Traducci√≥n: find a solution (must think about it rationally) (idear)
Example: We came up with a good road map for this quarter.

Title: To touch base
Traducci√≥n: To make brief contact for an update
Example: Let's touch base on Friday to check progress.

Title: To loop in
Traducci√≥n: To include someone in a communication
Example: I'll loop in the finance team on this decision.

Title: To bounce ideas off (someone)
Traducci√≥n: To discuss ideas to get feedback
Example: I like to bounce ideas off my lead developer before committing.

Title: To follow up (on)
Traducci√≥n: To take subsequent action or check on something
Example: Could you follow up on that vendor ticket?
